title.narrative: Moldova: Emergency response for Ukrainian refugees (contribution to EA)

description.narrative:
Contribution to Caritas Appeal: EA04/2022 Moldova Following Russian invasion of Ukraine (Feb 2022), thousands of people have fled Ukraine into neighbouring countries. Already one of the poorest countries in Europe, Moldova has seen an influx of over 100,000 Ukrainian refugees and more families are arriving daily. Approx. 45% of refugees entering Moldova have stayed in country.
Caritas Moldova seeks to support vulnerable Ukrainians to meet their essential needs during initial displacement through addressing following needs: - Vehicle transport for Ukrainians to move safely from borders to services - Safe, protected spaces for accommodation including continued support for 3 established collective centers (in Chisinau) and establishing a possible 5 additional centers based on evolving needs. - Supporting host community mobilisation - Provision of basic items like food, water, hygiene and living supplies. - Provision of psychosocial support. Geographical focus in and around capital city of Chisinau where many are arriving to access support and services.
Cross-Cutting: Caritas Moldova will staff-up both programming and administration positions to effectively respond to the emergency; mobilize and train volunteers; and ensure the material inputs of space, human resources, electricity, heat, fuel, furniture, and supplies are in place to equip centers and provide services.
Proposed number of beneficiaries: 9,600
